item.title: In My Hands: A Glimpse
item.description: We often try to touch something to find out if it is really there. Material presence of an object is determined by its material tangibility, or in other words, “I can touch it, therefore it is there. Film theorists often looked to the “plastic” materiality of film, photographic and cinematic alike, as proof of their “here-ness”. This became of exceptional importance when it came to discussing the “realism” of the filmic image: that the plastic materiality of the filmic image would anchor its validity as index to its referent.
